intro: Warrea costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican warrea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it produces capsules as its fruit.
